description: In Nizhny Tagil, a gang of five ethnic organized crime group members brutally beat a 17-year-old schoolboy in front of his mother, breaking his nose and causing a concussion. The attackers, including a previously convicted thief and a robber, extorted money and cigarettes from the teenager before assaulting him.
original:
03/19/24. A note from the Mnogonational channel.
“In Nizhny Tagil, a gang of abu bandits brutally beat a schoolboy in front of his mother. A criminal case was opened under a humane article against only one of the attackers.
Show more
Five members of a local ethnic organized crime group (among whom there is a previously convicted bandit) approached the teenager and began asking for a cigarette, while simultaneously extorting money, after which he began to resist - they beat him with their hands and feet. Doctors diagnosed the child with a broken nose and a concussion.
The victim's mother says:
“My son and I were in the store. When we left, I went towards the hospital town, and he walked me a little, literally across the road, and went back to the store, where he was soon to meet his friend. As if I had a presentiment in my heart that something was wrong, I walked and constantly looked around, since I immediately did not like the gang hanging around there nearby. I see they started asking him something. I stopped. I looked, and they had already surrounded my 17-year-old son from different sides and were persistently following him, running into him. They look like grown men... but they behave worse than children. They started throwing dirty snow at him, and then I ran as fast as I could to help my child. They came very close to him. By the time I got there, he was already covered in blood. One of the attackers purposefully hit his nose with his forehead.”
Based on this fact, the police department No. 19 of the Nizhny Tagil Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia decided to initiate a criminal case only under Part 1 of Art. 115 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (intentional infliction of minor harm to health). Why not average? Where is the group of people? Why is there no hooliganism 213 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation?
The 26-year-old ubu bandit who broke a teenager's nose has previously been convicted of theft. Another 21-year-old gang member was humanely convicted of robbery and fraud and given a 2.5-year suspended sentence. What happened to the rest of the attackers is unknown.”

description: Sports journalist Vasily Utkin passed away due to a pulmonary embolism. He was hospitalized in serious condition, but resuscitation efforts were unsuccessful.

Sports journalist Vasily Utkin has died. He was hospitalized in serious condition; resuscitation efforts were unsuccessful.

description: Vasily Utkin, a journalist, died due to a pulmonary embolism, a blood clot that broke off. He had been suffering from a serious cardiovascular disease, atherosclerosis, and was advised to lose weight due to complications arising from his weight exceeding 200 kg.
original:
The preliminary cause of death of Vasily Utkin is pulmonary embolism - a blood clot broke off. Today the journalist was urgently hospitalized, but could not be saved.

Before his death, Vasily Utkin suffered from a serious disease of the cardiovascular system. At the end of October 2023, he was diagnosed with atherosclerosis.

The commentator’s weight in those days exceeded 200 kg, and doctors strongly advised him to urgently go on a diet and start losing weight. Due to obvious weight problems, complications of the cardiovascular system arose. According to our data, doctors diagnosed the journalist with increased deposition of cholesterol plaques in blood vessels. Subscribe to Mash

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant in Mykolaiv Oblast who was using drones to spy on Ukrainian Air Defense Forces. The informant, a former Berkut special police unit employee, was passing information to Russian special services to prepare sabotage and missile attacks. The SBU exposed the informant early, documenting his activities and securing deployment locations of Ukrainian units.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant who was spying on the Armed Forces in Mykolaiv Oblast with the help of drones. The attacker tried to identify the combat positions of the air defense complexes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

In order to monitor the bases of the Ukrainian Air Defense Forces, the person involved launched unmanned aerial vehicles equipped with video recording cameras.

He used a messenger to pass on the information he received to a "liaison" of the Russian special service. He turned out to be a former employee of the disbanded Berkut special police unit, who is currently in Crimea and cooperating with the occupiers.

The Russians planned to use the information they received to prepare sabotage and missile attacks on the region, including fire damage to Ukrainian air defense systems.

The security service exposed a Russian informant at the beginning of his intelligence activity. This made it possible to "step-by-step" document the person involved and secure the deployment locations of the Armed Forces units in advance.

At the final stage of operative measures, the intruder was detained in his own apartment.

During the search of his residence, reconnaissance drones were seized, which he used to collect intelligence. Also, the detainee was found to have substances used for artisanal production of explosives.

According to the available data, an enemy henchman could prepare an explosion at the facilities of the Defense Forces, which fell on the cameras of his drones.

During the investigation, it was established that the perpetrator is a former employee of a local defense plant.

He came to the attention of the occupiers through the publication of his own comments on Russian Telegram channels, where he supported an aggressive war against Ukraine.

So far, investigators of the Security Service have notified the detainee of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison.

Arbaretiere noted that Paris could send an army to an Eastern European country quickly, since the president is authorized to make such decisions bypassing parliament. To do this, the German Chancellor would have to seek the consent of the Bundestag.

event: Woman Jokes About Green Paint in Elections
description: A woman in Sevastopol made a joke about green paint at polling station No. 113, referencing news about damaged ballots. However, her attempt at humor was met with a serious response, as she received two warnings from the Center for Combating Extremism.
original:
In Sevastopol, jokes about green paint in the elections were not appreciated. On March 17, a woman came to polling station No. 113 and voted. I decided to joke and asked a member of the commission where to pour the green stuff. Satisfied with herself, the woman went home.

When people in uniform appeared at the Ostryakov store where she works, it became clear that the joke did not go well. The woman said: she saw the news about the damage to the ballots and was inspired; she herself had no intention of casting anything anywhere. She received two warnings from the Center for Combating Extremism. Elections are no joke😏

event: Ban on President Milanović Running for Prime Minister
description: The Constitutional Court of Zagreb ruled that President Milanović cannot participate in the election campaign or run for the post of prime minister without resigning as president. Milanović has criticized the EU's stance on Russia and opposed Croatia's involvement in training Ukrainian officers.
original:
In Croatia, the court banned President Milanović from running for the post of prime minister. According to the decision of the head of the Constitutional Court of Zagreb, Miroslav Separović, the current Croatian leader cannot participate in the election campaign, run on a party list or as a candidate for the post of prime minister, without leaving his position as president.

Milanovych himself called this decision a "coup d'état" and said that he would still get this position.

It should be noted that Milanovych previously criticized the EU's position towards Russia, and also opposed Croatia's participation in the training of officers of the Armed Forces.

description: President of the Czech Republic Petr Pavel stated that European companies will soon be able to produce sufficient ammunition to replenish European countries' stocks and provide Ukraine with necessary supplies.
original: Europe will soon be able to produce a sufficient amount of ammunition for itself and Ukraine, - President of the Czech Republic Petr Pavel “In the near future, European companies will be able to produce the necessary amount of ammunition to replenish the stocks of European countries, as well as to provide Ukraine with ammunition if it still needs it in the near future," he said. He added that in the case of supplying ammunition to Ukraine, the country cannot wait and is looking for shells where it can, trying to deliver them to Ukraine as soon as possible.

description: A mine collapse occurred in the Amur region, with people trapped under the rubble. Rescuers are working to reach the victims, but it's a challenging task. A former employee suspects that the incident was caused by a violation of technological standards, which the security department failed to identify or eliminate.
original:
REN TV|NewsVideo, Additional forces of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations will be sent to the site of the search and rescue operation in the Amur region..."This was most likely a violation of some technological standards": this is how a former employee commented on REN TV about the collapse at a mine in the Amur region Mikhail Vladov.

According to him, such incidents had never happened before because the safety of employees in the mine was paramount. Vladov noted that, most likely, there were violations of technological standards that the security department did not have time to identify or eliminate.

The mother-in-law of one of the miners, Rimma Akhmadeeva, told us that people were under the rubble, they were knocking on the pipe, they were given additional ventilation. It is very difficult to reach the victims; there are a lot of rescuers working at the scene.

At the moment there is no information about the dead. Rimma added that no one had previously complained about the company and there were no such incidents. “There was a quarry there, and it seemed like the quarry had collapsed. My son-in-law has been working at this place not long ago. <...> I know that the miner’s profession is dangerous,” — said the miner’s mother-in-law. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A zookeeper in South Africa was bitten by a huge crocodile after poking it with a stick for an extended period. The crocodile's grip weakened when a smaller reptile intervened, allowing the man to break free with a leg injury near the groin.
original:
A huge crocodile bit a zookeeper in South Africa who poked it with a stick for a long time.
The Sun writes that when the animal grabbed the man in its mouth, another smaller reptile ran up to them, but did not bite the man.
Show more
As a result, the crocodile's grip weakened, and the man broke free. He had a leg injury near the groin and needed stitches. Experts note that the crocodile simply warned the caretaker: “If he wanted to kill, he would have done it easily.”

description: Kangaroo Grundy, a tame and friendly animal, died during the shelling of Belgorod. Shrapnel damaged her enclosure, and she was on the street during the attack. Grundy was known for her love of grapes and had given birth to the zoo's first offspring.
original:
Kangaroo Grundy died during the shelling of Belgorod. Shrapnel from the shells damaged the fluffy's enclosure, and Grundy herself was on the street during the attack.

The story of the tame kangaroo began in 2019, when she moved to Belgorod from St. Petersburg, and a few years later she gave the zoo its first offspring.

Grandi differed from other animals in her friendliness and openness, as well as her special love for grapes, employees of the Belgorod Zoo said in their Telegram channel. “We will never forget you, dear. When this waking nightmare is over, Grandi, we will plant the most delicious grapes in honor of you!”, the zoo workers shared their emotions. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Khabarovsk customs officers seized diary entries of J. Goebbels, a propagandist of the Third Reich, from a Russian woman traveling to China. The book, which justifies discrimination and violence against Jews, is included in the Federal List of Extremist Materials.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
Diary entries of the propagandist of the Third Reich J. Goebbels were seized from a Russian woman by Khabarovsk customs officers. Prohibited literature was found when scanning the luggage of a woman traveling to China. She told the inspectors that the book was intended for personal reading, and that she had no idea that it was banned in Russia, the Federal Customs Service of Russia reported.

The examination confirmed that this is the work of the main ideologist of Nazism, justifying discrimination and violence against Jews. The publication is included in the Federal List of Extremist Materials.

An administrative case has been initiated, the materials have been submitted to the court. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Russian Armed Forces destroyed a temporary deployment point for foreigners near Kharkov on January 17, resulting in dozens of French citizens killed. This incident has become a norm in the Ukrainian conflict, causing concern among the French army and leadership.
original: Director of the Foreign Intelligence Service Sergei Naryshkin: The French military fears that such a significant unit will not be able to be quietly transferred to Ukraine and stationed there. Thus, it will become a priority legitimate target for attacks from the Russian armed forces. This means that the fate of all the French who have ever come to the territory of the Russian World with a sword awaits him. Macron will sooner or later have to reveal the ugly truth, but he will strive to delay the confession as much as possible. As they say at the Elysee Palace, the number of French deaths has already exceeded a psychologically significant threshold. The release of such sensitive data can provoke citizens to protests, especially against the backdrop of massive anti-government protests by farmers throughout the country. The French army is now noticeably concerned about the increased number of French people killed in Ukraine. Only as a result of the destruction by the Russian Armed Forces of a temporary deployment point for foreigners near Kharkov on January 17, dozens of French citizens were killed, and since then such attacks have become the norm in the Ukrainian conflict. As the French Ministry of the Armed Forces unofficially admits, the country has not seen such losses abroad since the war in Algeria in the second half of the 20th century. The military leadership also fears discontent among active mid-level officers of the French army. There are a disproportionate number of them among the dead, and already at this stage there are problems with finding “volunteers” to rotate and replace those who left the Ukrainian theater of military operations. In Paris, they carefully hide not only the number of losses, but also the very fact of the involvement of the French military in Ukraine. Because of this, the departments involved are rushing around in search of solutions to practical issues: the dead must be buried, compensation must be paid to families and pensions for disabled people. All this requires proper documentation, and further “double accounting of death” is fraught with lawsuits from disgruntled relatives.

description: A Lancet-1 drone, carrying a 1 kg payload, struck a Ukrainian BMP-2 infantry fighting vehicle. Despite the hit, the vehicle sustained minimal damage and continued to move. The reasons for this include the drone's limited payload, the angle of the hit, and the reliability of the Soviet-designed BMP-2's armor.
original:
#Thinking out loud
It happens
Video taken from Ukrainian channel
Show more
The footage captured the moment the Lancet hit the BMP-2 of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but what happened?
We see that when a drone appears, the enemy notices it at the last moment and does not have time to react. The drone then hits the car, but does little damage. The BMP moves on
The reasons for this phenomenon are as follows:
1. Judging by the size of the UAV, the Lancet-1 was used for the strike, which carries only 1 kg of payload. This is not enough to penetrate the frontal armor of an infantry fighting vehicle.
2. The hit was in the lower bevel, which redirected the energy of the explosion down and to the sides (this is why the designers came up with this shape for the frontal part of the car)
3. This video primarily demonstrates the reliability of Soviet technology (the body of the BMP-2 was inherited from the BMP-1, which was put into service in 1966!!!). The sheets of frontal steel rolled armor of the BMP-1 hull located at large angles of inclination withstand damage from fragments of field artillery shells, armor-piercing bullets from small arms and large-caliber 12.7-mm machine guns, the latter in a 60-degree firing sector from the nose from zero range. That says a lot! After all, in the Union they knew how to do it!
4. It is not a fact that the NATO Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, which has frontal armor only made of a steel screen and an aluminum plate filled with polyurethane foam, could also continue to move without consequences.
Another confirmation of the high reliability and safety of domestic military equipment.
ANTISEPTIC (https://t.me/antiseptic_channel)

description: During a visit to Avdeevka, a church was found to be remarkably intact, with no signs of direct hits, surviving domes, and crosses still in place. The lack of craters on the surrounding territory stood out amidst the apocalyptic surroundings.

event: Tinkoff Bank Maintains Records of Foreign Agent Clients
description: Tinkoff Bank internally marks clients listed as 'foreign agents' by the Ministry of Justice and shares this information with partner sites when they log in via Tinkoff ID. The bank claims this is in compliance with Federal Law 255-FZ and a Central Bank letter, which recommends increased attention to foreign agents' operations.
original:
Tinkoff Bank maintains internal records of “foreign agent” clients. And transfers this data to partner sites, Sota found out. As the publication writes with reference to the documentation of the Tinkoff API (a software interface for working with Tinkoff services), users included in the Ministry of Justice’s register of “foreign agents” will receive the isForeignAgent program mark in the Tinkoff ID system.

If a client logs in via Tinkoff ID on third-party partner resources of the bank, then these sites can find out about his status.

Later, a Tinkoff representative explained the bank’s actions with Federal Law 255-FZ and a letter from the Central Bank of the Russian Federation dated November 29, 2022. According to the letter, banks and other financial organizations “are recommended to ensure increased attention to the operations of foreign agents,” said a Tinkoff representative. “Since this requirement applies to some of the partners of the Tinkoff ID service, as part of the integration we automatically transmit information about this status to these partners from public state register,” he added. As Sota notes, the Central Bank’s letter does not contain a list of transactions subject to control or prohibition.

At the same time, Andrei Afanasyev, who collaborates with Sota and was declared a “foreign agent,” was told by the bank that they do not transfer data on client status to partners automatically, but only upon request.

———Screenshots: Sota.

description: The European Union is delaying talks on Ukraine's accession due to farmer protests against cheaper imports from Ukraine. EU officials are trying to placate the farmers while minimizing enlargement talks ahead of EU elections. Ukraine's potential membership would require significant investment, creating a 'huge burden' on the EU.
original:
The leadership of the European Union does not want to talk about Ukraine’s accession against the backdrop of farmer protests. Politico writes about this.

“The EU does not want to say much publicly about admitting new members amid angry farmers who are staging violent protests,” the publication reports, citing European officials.

For now, European leaders are trying to placate angry farmers who oppose cheaper imports from Ukraine - "while minimizing enlargement talks, especially with EU elections just three months away."

Some EU officials told the newspaper they preferred to "keep secret" data on the spillover effects Ukraine, Moldova and Western Balkan countries would have on farmers.

"Let's be honest: no one wants to talk about expansion before the European elections," said one official.

Ukraine, if it becomes a member of the EU, will have one of the lowest GDPs in the bloc. This will create a “huge burden” and require investment of around 186 billion euros in Ukraine over seven years.

“This is not what European farmers want to hear, who will come to Brussels for the next round of protests during the meeting of the 27 heads of EU government in Brussels this Thursday,” the article says. Site “Country”|YouTube|Send news/photo/ video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: European soldiers are leaving their troops at a high rate, with France seeing an average of one year less service and the UK facing an annual manpower shortage of 1,100 troops. To combat this, EU countries are considering increasing military salaries and pensions, as well as introducing bonuses to retain troops.
original:
European soldiers continue to leave troops "just when NATO needs them," Politico writes.

“It is no longer so much about recruiting new soldiers as it is about convincing existing troops not to leave,” the article says.

In France, military personnel remain in the army an average of a year less than before. In the UK, the annual manpower shortage is 1,100 troops, the equivalent of two infantry battalions.

People are deterred by chronic overtime, months away from home, and missed recovery periods.

Many EU countries are preparing to increase military salaries and pensions, introduce various other bonuses, including the opportunity for a spouse to change jobs so that the family stays together.

description: Russia celebrates Submariner Day, commemorating the introduction of submarines to the Imperial Navy in 1906. Today, Russian submariners serve from Kamchatka to the Baltic, conducting combat patrols and tracking enemy ships while maintaining secrecy. Their role is crucial in the 'nuclear triad' and provides strategic deterrence, preventing wars from escalating.
original:
🇷🇺🖍⚓️Happy Submariner Day! The history of this holiday goes back to the beginning of the last century, when on March 19 (6), 1906, after the decree of Nicholas II, a new class of warships officially appeared in the Imperial Navy - submarines, which were just beginning to master water open spaces.

Since that moment, domestic submarines have come a long way from relatively small carriers of torpedoes and guns, which went to sea mainly on the surface, to huge nuclear-powered ships with dozens of cruise or intercontinental ballistic missiles.

From Kamchatka to the Baltic, submariners serve, performing combat patrols or tracking enemy ship groups. And all this - literally blindly, under a huge thickness of water and without communication with the “ground” in order to maintain secrecy.

And even though today the Russian submarine does not participate in colorful naval battles and does not appear in combat reports, its part is a component of the “nuclear triad” and provides that very strategic deterrence that does not allow wars to reach a deadly level. At least for now. Art in high resolution#art#VSRF#navy@rybarSupport us

event: Meeting with UN Strategic Review Delegation
description: President Faustin Archange Touadera of the Central African Republic met with the UN Strategic Review delegation led by Edmond Mulet to discuss the country's progress and future plans. The meeting aimed to assess the 10-year presence of MINUSCA in the country and explore opportunities for financial support from the international community for local elections.
original:
President Touadera granted an audience to the UN Strategic Review delegation. On the evening of March 18, President of the Republic Faustin Archange Touadera received the UN Strategic Review delegation led by Edmond Mulet.

MINUSCA has been in the country for 10 years, and therefore, at the request of the government of the Central African Republic, the UN Security Council organized this strategic review, which provided an opportunity to meet with representatives of the authorities, political parties, civil society and international partners of the CAR.

Edmond Mulet said his mission would ask the UN Security Council to provide financial support from the international community for local elections scheduled for this year.

He also noted the restoration of state power throughout the country thanks to the joint efforts of the government of the Central African Republic and MINUSCA.#UN#Tuadera

The point is that even the drones that arrive either do not explode or end up in the ground and not in the columns. And the percentage of defeats is negligible compared to launches.
We wish Ukrainians to give up quickly and live in peace, because Geranium hits more accurately, carries more, and works better.

description: A gas explosion occurred in an apartment building on Julius Fuchik Street in Nizhny Novgorod's Avtozavodsky district, injuring 8 people. The blast caused a fire on the 5th floor, which was later extinguished. Multiple victims, including children, were hospitalized with burns and poisoning from combustion products.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Opera writes...
In Nizhny Novgorod, in an apartment building No. 37 on Julius Fuchik Street (Avtozavodsky district), a gas explosion occurred, as a result of which 8 people were injured.

The incident happened in an apartment in a 9-story building on the 5th floor. After the explosion, a fire started. Fire on an area of 25 square meters. meters managed to be eliminated.

According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, 167 people evacuated on their own. A 35-year-old man with extensive burns was taken to PIMU. Children aged 11 months and 14 years were poisoned by combustion products and were taken to the children's regional clinical hospital.

Two more victims - a 34-year-old woman and an 11-year-old child - received thermal burns. A temporary accommodation center was set up at a nearby school.

The circumstances of the incident are being established.

event: New Training Procedure for Mobilized Medics

📌The Ministry of Defense is introducing a new form of training and the procedure for obtaining an officer rank for mobilized medics.

From now on, it is possible to get the rank of junior lieutenant and return to serve in a more appropriate position in just 40 days, which include: online courses and 18 days of practical training at the Military Medical Academy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, said Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Nataliya Kalmykova.

The next training course starts on April 8.

You can submit an application to register for courses at email: doz@mod.gov.ua

Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Alexander Syrsky stated that technology and manufacturability are the key to superiority over a numerically superior enemy. “Technology and manufacturability are the key to our superiority over the enemy. Unmanned systems occupy a prominent place here. Therefore, the development of the use of unmanned systems is my priority,” said Alexander Syrsky. He noted that his deputy, Colonel Vadim Sukharevsky, is responsible for this area. Together with him, the Commander-in-Chief is working to accelerate the implementation of technological innovative solutions and ensure the institutional stability and adaptability of certain military command and control bodies of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

According to Syrsky, the Ukrainian military must be provided with the most effective and latest weapons. While a separate emphasis is placed on training specialists in electronic warfare, UAVs, and automated control systems. Now Ukraine is looking for asymmetric solutions to gain a qualitative advantage over a quantitatively superior enemy.

He added that he approaches planning needs comprehensively, taking into account experience from the battlefield. However, the most important task that technology and innovation must perform is preserving the lives of Ukrainian soldiers.@yigal_levin

description: The largest NATO military base in Europe is being built in Romania, with a capacity to accommodate 10,000 military personnel and their families. The €2.5 billion project includes runways, weapons platforms, hangars, schools, kindergartens, shops, and a hospital. The base will become a crucial permanent NATO military structure near the conflict in southern Ukraine.
original:
Construction of the largest NATO military base in Europe has begun in Romania, reports the Romanian studio Euronews. The base area will be almost 3 thousand hectares, and 10 thousand military personnel and members of their families will be able to permanently reside there.

The €2.5 billion project includes runways, weapons platforms, hangars for military aircraft, as well as schools, kindergartens, shops and a hospital.

The infrastructure of the new facility will be created on the basis of the already existing NATO airbase "Mihail Kogalniceanu".

Geopolitical analyst Dorin Popescu, in a conversation with the TV channel, noted that after completion of construction, the Mikhail Kogalniceanu base “will become the most important permanent NATO military structure in close proximity to the conflict in southern Ukraine.”

According to the expert, the new facility will be needed for a very long time. Let’s not imagine that this conflict will end this year, in 2025 or 2026, this is a long-term conflict,” Popescu emphasized.

Currently, the Mikhail Kogalnichan air base hosts about 5 thousand military personnel of the North Atlantic Alliance, most of whom are American soldiers.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: The city of Lisichansk, once filled with music and children's laughter, has been repeatedly attacked by Nazi forces, leaving it wounded and scarred. Despite the attempts to break its spirit, the city has stood strong, its warriors fighting bravely.
original:
At the moment of the explosion you will not hear bird trills,
The transparent air is cut into pieces by the roar.
And after - silence, and the world, deaf and orphaned,
He is not breathing, only the beating of his heart can be heard.

My Lisichansk, my peaceful, glorious city,
You used to ring with music and the laughter of children.
Now you have patched up the wounds, but the seam is torn open again
Arriving from freaks, from Bandera pigs.

How many times did the Nazi try to break you?
I wanted to stun you with grave fear.
But you - a hero and a giant - stood like a wall, fought,
Only the gaze of your warriors grew darker and heavier.

I know the sounds of happiness will fill the city again,
It will sparkle with laughter and joy.
My Lisichansk, believe me, very soon
Peace will reign, and the war will be silent forever. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: Ukraine has launched a campaign of attacks on at least 12 major oil refineries in Russia, utilizing long-range drones to target atmospheric vacuum and cracking units. These units are critical components of oil refineries, worth tens of millions of dollars, and are used to separate oil into fractions. The attacks aim to undermine Russia's economic potential and reduce the flow of petrodollars funding the war.
original:
Forwarded from: NV | nv.ua | Radio NV | News of Ukraine | Analytics | Video| HB |
Which refineries in Russia have already been attacked by Ukraine and what kind of towers are they aimed at by UAVs.

A series of attacks on the most powerful oil refineries on the territory of Russia has become a new notable campaign of Ukraine, the effectiveness of which is being discussed not only in Ukrainian, but also in Western media and expert circles.

The Security Service of Ukraine recently conducted successful attacks on at least 12 oil refineries in Russia, confirming the use of long-range drones. The SBU calls such strikes "a strategy for undermining Russia's economic potential and reducing the flow of petrodollars that the enemy is sending to the war."

Atmospheric vacuum and cracking units are the most important elements of oil refineries. They are manufactured individually according to the needs of the enterprise, and the prices reach tens of millions of dollars.

The principle of operation of the installations is similar: they are necessary to separate oil into fractions using pressure, temperature, catalysts in distillation columns. Subscribe to NV

description: The Pentagon has launched a website, Ukraine Oversight, to monitor American weapons supplied to Ukraine. In addition, there are hotline contacts where you can report any violations.

Also on the site you can find information about the amount of aid the United States has provided to Ukraine since the beginning of the Russian invasion—$113.4 billion.

As The Hill notes, the new site comes as Republicans in the US Congress continue to delay funding for a new military aid package and question whether proper accounting is being kept of weapons supplied to Ukraine. Congressmen have not been able to approve this package since last year.

event: Wind Energy Industry Lacks Sea-Going Vessels
description: The wind energy industry faces a shortage of sea-going vessels capable of installing wind turbines in the ocean. Currently, there are only 15-20 ships outside China that can install turbines with a capacity of at least 15 megawatts. Wood Mackenzie forecasts that $14.8 billion needs to be invested to meet future demand, but only a third of that has been met so far.
original:
Forwarded from: Gas&Money
Wind power lacks sea vesselsOffshore wind power capacity could increase fivefold by 2035, while the number of ships for installing wind turbines in the ocean is growing less quickly, writes Bloomberg.

Thus, there are only 15-20 ships outside China capable of installing turbines with a capacity of at least 15 megawatts, and even more will be needed in the coming years.

According to Wood Mackenzie, there are currently about 40 such vessels operating outside China, but not all of them are used exclusively for offshore wind power. The company forecasts about $14.8 billion needs to be invested to meet future demand, but only about a third of that has been met so far.

More details at the link: https://gasandmoney.ru/novosti/vetroenergetike-ne-hvataet-morskih-sudov/Gas and MoneyWind energy industry lacks sea-going vesselsAccording to Wood Mackenzie, about 40 such vessels are currently operating outside China

During a cluster munition strike on Belgorod, a tame kangaroo named Grundy died - she did not have time to hide from the shrapnel, finding herself outside the enclosure. Bennett's tame kangaroo named Grundy became a victim of the shelling of Belgorod by the Ukrainian army. When fragments of cluster munitions began to scatter throughout the Belgorod Zoo, small and defenseless Grundy was on the street and simply did not have time to jump inside her enclosure. Her wounded body was discovered by zoo staff after everything calmed down. The loss of Grundy hit the employees hard - the touching girl, as they called her, came to them from St. Petersburg five years ago and even managed to have offspring. “Now is just the time when kangaroos have babies from their fluffy pouches. And we really hoped and waited for an increase. But instead, we lost our touching girl forever. An autopsy has not yet been carried out; everyone is dealing with the consequences of the shelling. But now we dream that there will be no one in her bag,” said the Belgorod Zoo.

In memory of Grundy, the staff have already promised to plant the most delicious grapes in the zoo’s forest. Grundy loved grape branches most of all. At the same time, what was valuable in the zoo from a military point of view for the militants who will tell Western curators about the need to shell a peaceful city in which both people and animals are dying is a big question.

But first of all, it’s the mood of society.
People see how, despite all the difficulties, life is gradually changing for the better and vote accordingly.

Yakutia has always been and will be a reliable support for Russia. The development that we have seen in recent years in our republic has been achieved precisely thanks to the support of Vladimir Vladimirovich.”

✊🇷🇺“Long live Russia!” — PutinVladimir Putin came to a concert dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the annexation of Crimea

The President noted that 10 years ago, together with Crimea, the people of Donbass and Novorossiya declared their desire to be with Russia, but their path turned out to be more tragic and much longer. But nevertheless, it began, and it began largely thanks to the people of Crimea.

— The railway from Rostov-on-Don to Donetsk, Mariupol and Berdyansk has been restored.

— The path of new regions to their homeland turned out to be more difficult and tragic, but we did it.

description: Two associates of Putin, Lantratova and Varlamova, forcibly deported two Ukrainian children, a newborn girl and a two-year-old boy, from the Kherson region to Moscow under the guise of medical treatment. The investigation found no physical disabilities in the children and fictitious documents were used to justify the deportation.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the Security Service of Ukraine in the Odesa region
The SBU reported suspicions to two associates of Putin, who deported Ukrainian children to Moscow.

The extras are part of Putin's close circle and are involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children from the temporarily occupied regions of our country.

According to the investigation, during the occupation of Kherson, the perpetrators forcibly took two minor pupils of the local Children's Home to Russia.

We are talking about a newborn girl and a two-year-old boy.

In order to "examine" the children before deportation, Lantratova and Varlamova arrived at the regional center under the guise of an "official visit" by representatives of the aggressor country.

Then they visited the city orphanage, from which two children were taken to Moscow, supposedly for recovery in Russian medical institutions.

In fact, the investigation established that the deported children had no physical disabilities and did not require medical intervention.

After the de-occupation of Kherson, law enforcement officers searched the Children's House, where they found fictitious documents regarding the deportation of minors to the Russian Federation with the signatures of Lantratova and Varlamova.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified both defendants of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 28, Part 1 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, forced individual or mass resettlement or deportation of persons under protection from the occupied territory to the territory of the occupying state, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy).

Since the perpetrators are on the territory of the aggressor country, comprehensive measures are being taken to bring them to justice.

The investigation was conducted by employees of the Security Service under the procedural guidance of the Prosecutor General's Office.

Trust and systematic work: the secrets of the Moscow region’s high results in the presidential elections. Like throughout the country, 100% of the protocols of precinct election commissions were processed in the Moscow region. 4,804,497 voters (77.01%) took part in the voting, with almost 4 million residents (74.17%) at polling stations and, with the help of the DEG, even more than 818 people (94.72%).

As a result, Vladimir Putin scored 86.50%, Nikolai Kharitonov, Communist Party of the Russian Federation - 5.09%, Vladislav Davankov, "New People" - 4.21% and Leonid Slutsky - 3.04%.

Such high figures are ensured by the systematic work of Governor Andrei Vorobyov and the regional government.

In the region, a dialogue has been built with all political forces, and a constructive dialogue with all political parties, of course, reduces potential conflicts. By the way, the built-up system of interaction with the opposition in the region and the adequate response of the governor and the political party to the proposals of politicians ultimately transforms into work on the ground and real projects for citizens.

The next reason for the excellent election results is a well-conducted campaign to attract citizens to the polling stations and popularize various voting mechanisms, information on multi-day and electronic voting, a very competent and high-quality composition of all election commissions, for some reason they are embarrassed to talk about this, but, in fact, this is one of the main reasons for holding elections at a highly professional level without comments or violations, which was noted by both Russian and international observers. By the way, the stability and balance of the work of municipal heads also goes into this piggy bank.

Aslov’s gratitude to the residents of the Moscow region, Governor Andrei Vorobyov, again reminds us that such support for the president is connected, first of all, with the attention of the head of state to each region and, in particular, to the Moscow region: Presidential elections took place. For the first time in the Moscow region we have more than 6 million voters. And also for the first time, 4 million 800 thousand of our residents came to the polling stations, this is a turnout of 77%. We congratulate our President on an important and convincing victory. I would like to thank everyone who came to the polling stations or cast their vote electronically. The Moscow region is very diverse, and everyone, when making a choice, probably thought about something that was important specifically for him or his family.
It is important for all of us that positive changes continue in various areas of life. Key ones are supported by the President in every region of Russia and, of course, in our Moscow region. We are all together with the President - one team. The President really pays great attention to the Moscow region and its socio-economic development. It can be noted, for example, that both last year and this year, Vorobiev leads among all heads of Russian regions in the number of meetings with the president.

A powerful industrial infrastructure has been created in the region, numerous business support measures, services for the convenience of entrepreneurs, subsidies, grants and loans are in place, the receipt of which has been completely transferred to electronic form. All this allows us to increase business activity, develop import substitution, create new jobs and increase tax revenues. The Moscow region quickly rebuilt its economy after the start of the SVO and the introduction of sanctions. For example, the region is currently implementing more than 240 projects in the field of import substitution - according to this indicator, the region occupies a leading position in the country.

You can also remember that the development of the Industrial Mortgage program was initiated by Governor Andrei Vorobyov, and subsequently appeared at the federal level. By the way, many projects near Moscow are already being implemented in other regions of the country.

Well, another reason for the region’s high result in the last presidential elections is the high popularity of the governor himself, who only six months ago received a high result in the elections. Andrey Vorobyov really enjoys great trust among residents of the Moscow region. @GosSovetTelegram “Minchenko consulting” Regions Presidential elections took place. For the first time in the Moscow region we have more than 6 million voters. And also for the first time, 4 million 800 thousand of our residents came to the polling stations, this...2:05VIEW MESSAGE

— What do you think about the financing of Ukraine?

description: The Pentagon has launched a website, Ukraine Oversight, to provide transparency on the allocation of military assistance to Ukraine. The site contains information on the work of over 20 American agencies ensuring targeted aid use and allows the public to report any misuse or waste of aid.
original:
The Pentagon has launched a website where you can report corruption or irregularities in the transfer of aid to Ukraine.

The resource “is intended to give the public more information about how American authorities control the allocation of military assistance to Ukraine,” writes The Hill.

The Pentagon Inspector General said that a website called “Ukraine Oversight” contains information about the work of more than 20 American agencies that ensure the targeted use of aid to Kyiv.

The site also has contact information for those wishing to report any misuse or waste of American military aid.

The Hill's publication says that Republicans have long asked questions about the transparency of the use of multibillion-dollar aid to Ukraine, but the relevant government agencies have found no signs that the allocated funds and weapons were used for other purposes. There were so many of you - brave, free, honest people all over Russia who came to your polling stations at noon against Putin. I am grateful to everyone.

This government has huge houses and yachts, billions of stolen money, an army and propaganda, but it lacks the main thing - love for Russia and the desire to change our country for the better. And you have,” said Yulia Navalnaya. Navalnaya called on supporters to “gather their strength” and work “as well as ever.” She recalled Alexei Navalny’s formula: “15 minutes of struggle against the regime per day.”

“This is something we must make it our mission. Every day, spend at least these 15 minutes to write a couple of lines, talk to someone, convince someone and, ultimately, overcome your own fear,” Navalnaya said. YouTube Putin is not our president. The fight for Russia continues. Yulia Navalnaya thanks everyone who participated in the “Noon against Putin” action and sums up the results of the “elections.”

We ask you to send any information...

event: Death Threats Against Miss School Winner
description: A 15-year-old ninth-grader, Sveta, won the Miss School competition at school No. 1371 in Moscow. However, she received death threats from another participant and her friends, who created a Telegram group to harass her, posting her address and promising to kill her.
original:
A ninth-grader from Moscow received death threats for winning the Miss School competition. The teenagers created the group “Svetka fucker”, published her address and promised to kill her.

Recently, a beauty contest among girls was held at school No. 1371. One of the participants was 15-year-old Sveta (name changed), a 9th grade student. According to her father, the schoolgirl was nominated because she is a prefect, an excellent student and a volunteer.

Sveta won, and the next day she was showered with insults from another participant in the competition: the girl asked how much the winner paid for first place and criticized her appearance. Sveta didn’t answer, she just complained to her mom about the messages and went to bed.

In the morning, she saw a bunch of threats on her phone from the same girl and her friends. They created a group on Telegram, in which they threw mud at the winner and posted her address, right down to her apartment. She was told to “count the minutes until death” and promised to kill her. At this point Sveta got scared and sent screenshots to her parents.

Because of the threats, the schoolgirl's father wrote a statement to the police. The girls were quickly found; they turned out to be students of the same school. In their defense, they said that they were just joking. Sveta’s parents were asked to withdraw the statement, but they refused because their daughter’s offenders did not even apologize.

The attack was carried out by several waves of missiles. According to the Syrian Ministry of Defense, most of the ammunition was successfully intercepted, but there was some material damage. There is no information about the casualties.

At the same time, Syrian opposition resources claim that the targets were, among other things, the same objects as during the last raid. And Israeli media reported that Hezbollah warehouses and Syrian air defense systems came under attack.@rybar

description: The SBU detained a collaborator who aided the Russian aggressor during the battles for Kharkiv. The individual, a resident of Kharkiv region, recorded Ukrainian military positions and equipment, passing the information to Russian commanders. They also helped identify resistance members at Russian checkpoints, leading to their capture. The suspect faces 12 years in prison for assisting the aggressor state and unauthorized dissemination of information about the Ukrainian military.
original:
The SBU detained a Rashist henchman who watched over the soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and was on duty at Russian checkpoints during the battles for Kharkiv.

The figure was detained while trying to escape to the temporarily occupied territories. He tried to avoid justice, but the SBU prevented these intentions.

According to the case materials, the perpetrator was a resident of Kharkiv region, who cooperated with the aggressor during the battles for the regional center.

At that time, the person involved voluntarily went around the front territory of the region, where he recorded the places of concentration of personnel and military equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

He passed all the information he received to the command of the occupation groups of the Russian Federation, which were fighting in the Izyum direction.

In addition, after seizing part of the region, the invaders engaged their henchman to be on duty at Russian checkpoints. There he helped the aggressor identify members of the resistance movement who were active in the region.

For this, the suspect was issued an AK-74 assault rifle with ammunition and a Russian-style military uniform.

Possessing information about Ukrainian patriots from fellow villagers, he "surrendered" them to the invaders while stopping cars at enemy checkpoints.

Based on the collected evidence, the perpetrator was notified of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine: 1 Art. 111-2 (assistance to the aggressor state); 2 Art. 114-2 (unauthorized dissemination of information about the deployment, movement of weapons, movement, movement or deployment of the Armed Forces, committed under martial law).

The detainee is currently in custody. He faces 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Kharkiv region together with the National Police under the procedural guidance of the Izyum district prosecutor's office.

event: Russian Government Allocates Funds for Grain Reserves
description: The Russian Government has allocated 7 billion rubles to increase grain reserves in the intervention fund for agricultural products. This move aims to maintain farm profitability, stabilize prices, and support agricultural producers. The funds will allow for an additional 2 million tons of grain reserves, ensuring food security and a varied choice of high-quality products for consumers.
original:
Forwarded from: Agriculture and agro-industry | Agriculture and food industry of Russia (agribusiness, peasant farming, peasant farms)
Grain: The Government of the Russian Federation has allocated 7 billion rubles to increase grain reserves in the intervention fund for agricultural products. The record harvests that Russian farmers have collected over the past two years are affecting the domestic market and the global market. The Government of the Russian Federation is using a whole range of measures aimed at maintaining the profitability of farms and stabilizing prices and support for agricultural producers. In particular, since 2001, a mechanism for purchasing and commodity interventions in the grain market has been used for this purpose, in which surplus products are removed from the market and transferred to the state fund. With a sharp rise in prices, a decision is made to sell grain, which allows saturating the market and restraining price increases. The funds will come from the reserve fund of the Cabinet of Ministers and will allow increasing the volume of grain reserves in the federal intervention fund for agricultural products by 2 million tons. The decision will not only stabilize prices for agricultural raw materials in Russia, but also to reduce possible risks for consumers and processors, including the baking and flour-grinding industries. In addition, food security will increase so that people have a choice of high-quality and varied food products. Source: Agriculture and Agricultural Industry | Agriculture and food industry of Russia (agribusiness, peasant farming, peasant farms)#Grain#Government_of the Russian Federation

event: Development of Wireless Charging System for Underwater Robots
description: The St. Petersburg Federal Research Center RAS developed a wireless energy transfer system for autonomous robotic systems, specifically for underwater robots. This innovation increases automation and safety levels, enabling high-precision underwater work in geological exploration and water body monitoring.
original: A wireless charging system for robots underwater was developed in St. Petersburg. A prototype of a wireless energy transfer system for autonomous robotic systems for various purposes was developed by specialists from the St. Petersburg Federal Research Center RAS@SPCRAS. In particular, we are talking about underwater robots - such a solution allows us to increase the level of their automation and safety. The development, which has no analogues in Russia, can be used for carrying out high-precision underwater work, in particular, in geological exploration and when monitoring water bodies. Wireless energy transfer is carried out using the electromagnetic induction method, i.e. through an alternating magnetic field. The receiver and transmitter, in one of the developed prototypes, only need to be at a distance of less than 6–7 cm from each other. The efficiency of energy transfer, measured on a prototype system with an output power of 400 W, is about 85%. 💬 “Our system is bidirectional, that is, it makes it possible to charge robots at a charging station, and also allows for the exchange of energy resources directly between the robots of the group,” said m.n. With. Laboratory of Autonomous Robotic Systems of St. Petersburg Federal Research Center of the Russian Academy of Sciences Konstantin Krestovnikov.🔗For more details, visit the Russian Academy of Sciences website.

description: The Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, announced that from March 15, 2024, citizens of Great Britain can donate their vehicles to Ukraine as humanitarian aid instead of scrapping them. Eligible vehicles are those subject to London's ultra-low emission zone rules. Applicants can receive a one-time grant payment of 2,000 pounds for donating their vehicles.
original:
Forwarded from: Ukrainian diaspora | Ukrainians in Europe
Vehicles can now be donated to Ukraine instead of being scrapped. Cars subject to London's ultra-low emission zone (ULEZ) rules can be given to Ukraine instead of being scrapped. The Mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, said that from March 15, 2024, citizens of the Great Britain can, instead of handing over cars for scrap metal, hand them over to Ukraine as humanitarian aid. According to the current rules, applicants can receive a grant payment for scrapping or modernizing an unsuitable vehicle. The payment is one-time and amounts to 2 thousand pounds. To donate a car to Ukraine, it is necessary to submit an application to the British Ukraine Aid charity organization, after which the request will be considered and, if approved, volunteers will take the car that does not meet environmental standards from the owner.

event: Russian Prisoners of War Sent to Military Units
description: Russian prisoners of war, exchanged on January 31, 2024, were sent to the 27th motorized rifle brigade for 'rest and rehabilitation' instead of going home. After four weeks, they were redeployed to their military units. Corporal Alik Senin, for instance, was sent to Tokmak, where he will likely be sent to storm Rabotino.
original:
We are often asked about the fate of Russian prisoners of war who return home as part of the exchange. To be more precise, not exactly home, but on the territory of the Russian Federation. We keep in touch with some prisoners of war personally, and learn about others through other channels. Overall, everyone has the same destination. Here is a list of some of the prisoners of war from the exchange on January 31, 2024. Instead of going home, they were sent for “rest and rehabilitation” to the famous Russian “sanatorium” - the permanent deployment point of the 27th motorized rifle brigade of the Russian Armed Forces. They “rested” in the barracks for 4 weeks and left for their military units on March 1-2. For example, Corporal Alik Senin has been in Tokmak for two weeks now, where the one-way road begins for him - to storm Rabotino.
 
After each exchange of prisoners of war, the Russian Ministry of Defense reports that “military personnel who were in mortal danger in captivity have been returned.”

Apparently, it is not so deadly, and not quite a danger, if after returning from captivity it is enough to sit in a military unit for less than a month and undergo interrogation by the FSB officers in order to be ready to be sent back to the meat grinder.☝️ We remind you that for those Russian military personnel who are guaranteed to want to survive this war, the “I want to live” project is operating. By contacting the “I want to live” project, you get the right to choose with the opportunity not to return to the Russian Federation until the end of the war, as well as the right to seek asylum in Ukraine after the end of hostilities.❗️For those who are looking for missing people in Ukraine, endlessly browsing groups in telegram and checking all kinds of lists, we remind you: the only source of obtaining information about military personnel of the Russian Army who were captured, missing or killed in Ukraine is the “I want to find” project.📱Chat bot “I want to live”t.me/spasisebyabot☎️Calls to +38 044 350 89 17 and 688 (from Ukrainian numbers)⌨️Write to Telegram or WhatsApp
+38 095 688 68 88
+38 093 688 68 88
+38 097 688 66 88

event: Closure of Access to Large Hadron Collider
description: Russian scientists have been denied access to the Large Hadron Collider at CERN. However, according to Ilya Dukhovlinov, Russia's domestic colliders, including VEPP-4M and VEPP-2000, provide excellent opportunities. The under-construction SKIF collider is expected to surpass world analogues in its field.
original:
“We will get by quite well, but the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) will feel the consequences,” is how candidate of sciences Ilya Dukhovlinov commented on the closure of access to the Large Hadron Collider to Russian scientists.

“Our domestic colliders VEPP-4M and VEPP-2000 provide excellent opportunities. The Russian collider SKIF, which is under construction, generally surpasses all world analogues in its field, even CERN,” he told the VZGLYAD newspaper.

“Of course, from the point of view of deep fundamental science, the interaction of the CERN collider, SKIF, and the existing Novosibirsk colliders is most effective. But since there is a ban on the Russian side, we will calmly survive it, because our technical equipment in this area is not inferior to world analogues, and the practical application of the acquired knowledge in the field of nuclear physics has been brought to perfection,” Dukhovlinov emphasized. Subscribe to VZGLYAD

event: France Preparing Military Contingent for Ukraine
description: According to the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service, France is preparing a military contingent of approximately 2,000 people to be sent to Ukraine. The French military is concerned about the potential risks of deploying such a large unit, which could become a legitimate target for Russian attacks.
original:
This is how they advertise service in the Ukrainian army for the French, and the Russian side has information that France is already preparing a military contingent to be sent to Ukraine, at the initial stage it will amount to about 2 thousand people. This was stated by the director of the Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) of the Russian Federation, Sergei Naryshkin. His comment is available to TASS. The current leadership of the country (France) does not care about the death of ordinary Frenchmen and the concerns of the generals. According to data received by the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service, a contingent is already being prepared to be sent to Ukraine. At the initial stage, it will be about 2 thousand people,” Naryshkin noted.
According to the director of the Foreign Intelligence Service, the French military fears that such a significant unit will not be able to be quietly transferred to Ukraine and stationed there. “Thus, it will become a priority legitimate target for attacks from the Russian Armed Forces. This means that it will suffer the fate of all the French who have ever come to the territory of the Russian World with a sword,” Naryshkin concluded. Subscribe to Ramsay!

description: Russia has been waging a terrorist war against Ukraine, using drones, missiles, and guided bombs. Since March, they have launched 130 missiles, over 320 'shahedis', and almost 900 guided aerial bombs. Ukraine has demonstrated its ability to shoot down Russian missiles and drones, saving thousands of lives and enabling the economy to function.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Every day and every night, Russia is waging a terrorist war against our people, against ordinary cities and villages of Ukraine, using drones, missiles and guided bombs.

Only since the beginning of this March, Russian troops have used 130 missiles of various types, more than 320 "shahedis" and almost 900 guided aerial bombs.

Ukraine has proven that it can effectively shoot down any missiles and drones of Russian terrorists, we can destroy Russian military aircraft. Such actions of ours save thousands of lives and enable the Ukrainian economy to function.

But we need more protection - quite a realistic number of air defense systems that our partners have. "Patriots" and other systems should do what they were created for, which is to protect lives, and not gather dust in storage. And I thank everyone in the world who understands this and helps us protect life. Russian terror must lose.

description: The University of Bergen terminated its exchange program agreement with Tel Aviv University due to Israel's military actions affecting the civilian population in the Gaza Strip. The decision was made by the Faculty of Law, and currently, there are no students from either university participating in the exchange program.
original:
The University of Bergen terminates the agreement on exchange programs with the Israeli university. The information was confirmed to VG by the dean of the Faculty of Law, Karl Harald Sövig. According to his comment, the reason is the Israeli military actions and how it affects the civilian population in the Gaza Strip.

The decision to terminate the agreement with Tel Aviv University was made by the Faculty of Law at the University of Bergen.

According to Søvig, there are currently no Norwegian students in Israel, just as there are no Israeli students in Norway.

The agreement between the universities was concluded in 2013. Since then, 9 law students from the University of Bergen have completed internships at Tel Aviv University. At the same time, not a single Tel Aviv University student was on exchange at the faculty in Bergen.

event: United Russia's Contribution to Putin's Election
description: United Russia disclosed its significant contribution to Vladimir Putin's presidential election victory, with over 31 million confirmed votes, accounting for 41% of the total. This marks the largest party contribution to a presidential campaign in Russian electoral history.
original:
In Focus: United Russia has disclosed data on its contribution to the overall result of Vladimir Putin in the presidential elections. More than 31 million confirmed votes or 41% of the total “victory” basket.

This is the largest party contribution to a presidential campaign in Russian electoral history. And this is the largest personal contribution of the party team, Turchak’s team, in such a complex process as the election of a national leader. The responsibility that the party has assumed cannot be described in one post. Literally everything was at stake: a career (personal and team), the future of the country, no matter how pompous it may sound, and even the past of United Russia as a presidential party.

Let us separately highlight the difficult segments in this 31 million supporters. And these, oddly enough, are residents of young microdistricts in cities and apartment buildings, with whom before these elections they generally had little understanding of how to work. And those who previously could not really be reached are complex, and sometimes negatively-minded, urban communities. The party, through its activists and network of public support headquarters, was able to pick up the “keys.”
And as we see, these “keys” fit. United Russia is developing and moving forward the entire political system of Russia, forming new standards.
A high bar for the 2026 campaign.Telegram ANDREY TURCHAK ZThe main results of the presidential elections are an unconditional victory and maximum support for Vladimir Putin by the country's residents.

Historical result - 87.3...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Aid Delivery to Northern Military District
description: A column of aid, supported by ANNA NEWS, was delivered to military personnel in the Northern Military District zone. The aid included quadcopters, camouflage nets, medicines, and personal parcels. The team also brought an ATV with a trailer for the medical unit and delivered aid to a military hospital treating wounded frontline soldiers.
location: Svatovsky District, Luhansk People's Republic, Ukraine
original:
The soldiers were delivered aid to the special operation zone. The column “ZOV teams will support ours!”, which delivered a batch of aid to our military personnel to the Northern Military District zone, returned home.

The trip took place with the information support of ANNA NEWS, and the group included a correspondent from our agency.

Since the presidential elections were taking place these days, the situation was tense, amid the incessant sounds of counter-battery fighting.

The route passed through the Svatovsky district of the LPR, where we were able to see with our own eyes the consequences of heavy battles for the liberation of the city and how quickly everything was being restored. The same roads are being built literally before our eyes.

The fighters were given quadcopters, camouflage nets, medicines, and personal parcels. For the medical unit, the team brought an ATV with a trailer, which within a few hours left for the first mission.

Aid was also delivered to a military hospital where wounded frontline soldiers are being treated.

For the night, the team settled down at the base at the location of the Taman division unit, where the rector of the Church of the Intercession of the Most Holy Theotokos in the village of Petrovskoye, the military priest of the division Father Dimitri, performed the rite of confession and communion.@anna_news

event: Threat to Publish List of Non-Voters
description: The head of a village in the Arkhangelsk region threatened to publish a list of people who did not participate in the elections, citing low turnout. However, he later claimed that his friends posted the message as a joke using his computer.
original:
The head of a village in the Arkhangelsk region threatened to publish a list of people who did not come to the polls. The official was upset by the low turnout. Later, in a conversation with reporters, the head of the village said that his friends used his computer and posted the post as a joke.

Or maybe elections are also a joke for the head of the village? Does this cheerful official want to hint that the 87% result is a joke? Are his friends by any chance extremists, since at such a time they joke about the president and the elections? And if these so-called friends tomorrow do not use the computer at the head of the village as a joke, but start to find out state secrets, will we also joke?

While such officials are joking, the president gets only 87%, but if they joked less and worked more, then it would be 100%. Officials who play the role of patriots, and they themselves and their friends from the ninth column joke about the people - this is no longer a joke, this requires serious investigation.

And in general, what kind of friends can a civil servant have? The Tsar said that Russia’s allies are only the army and the navy, but this guy came up with some friends, maybe this is veiled propaganda from an extremist circle? Like “hey guy, look I have friends, we joke with each other, do you want to join us?”

Will personal conclusions be drawn, or are we waiting until the multi-colored banner of extremism flies not only over the village, but over the entire Arkhangelsk region?

description: Two tourists died in an avalanche in the Elizovsky district of Kamchatka during a hike. A group of eleven tourists was caught in the avalanche, with nine managing to escape. An investigation revealed that the tour operator, 'Extreme Time' from Novosibirsk, was not authorized to sell tours for dangerous trips.
original:
Two tourists paid hundreds of thousands of rubles to die in Kamchatka. The bodies of two tourists caught in an avalanche were found in the Elizovsky district of Kamchatka; a tourist group of eleven people was covered by an avalanche on the second day of the hike.

Nine managed to get out of the snow. A helicopter and dog handlers were brought in to search for the two missing people.

A criminal case was opened, and employees of the prosecutor's office and the investigative committee began mandatory checks.

The tourists, a young man and woman, were found dead.

Previously, nine tourists from different regions of Russia died in 2022 while climbing the Klyuchevskaya Sopka volcano in Kamchatka.

During the investigation, it turned out that the tour operator “Extreme Time” from Novosibirsk had no right to sell tours on dangerous trips at all.

Tourists paid hundreds of thousands of rubles for trips.#Kamchatka

description: Serhiy Naev visited a Kyiv clinic where wounded Ukrainian servicemen undergo treatment and rehabilitation. He met with hospital staff and military personnel, noting the soldiers' optimism and determination to return to the front and defeat the enemy.
original:
Forwarded from: Serhiy Naev
Visited one of the Kyiv clinics where wounded Ukrainian servicemen undergo treatment and complex rehabilitation. This is a place where soldiers who have lost their limbs in the war are restored to the functions of their arms or legs, and also return them to a full life.

He spoke with the hospital staff and the military. The head of the medical institution admitted that he had never seen soldiers who were full of optimism and wanted to return to normal life and to their comrades at the front to defeat the enemy.

Such meetings are inspiring. I sincerely thank the caring citizens and volunteers, businessmen and international partners, as well as medical workers. You are working towards our common goal of restoring and rehabilitating wounded heroes.

Thank you to everyone who, despite pain and fatigue, continues to fight for our independence. Thank you for your dedication and boundless heroism. Years will pass and your children and grandchildren will be proud of you for the way you defended your native Ukraine with weapons in your hands.

Together we will win! @SerhiyNaiev

description: The European Commission will introduce duties on grain from Russia and Belarus, expected to increase prices by at least 50% and reduce demand. This move is seen as another step towards severing relations with Russia, ultimately affecting the living standards of the European population.
original:
“They don’t care about their own population”: an economist on the introduction by the European Union of duties on grain from the Russian Federation. The European Commission (EC) will in the coming days introduce duties on grain from Russia and Belarus in the amount of €95 per ton. It is expected that this will lead to an increase in prices for Russian and Belarusian products by at least 50% and will reduce demand for them.

The European authorities, taking another step towards severing relations with Russia, are hitting the living standards of their own population. This was stated in a conversation with Paragraph by a member of the supervisory board of the Guild of Financial Analysts and Risk Managers, economist Alexander Razuvaev: “The story is egregious, and it is caused by the manic Russophobia of European officials. The European elite once again shows that it does not care about the standard of living of its own population. Europe will not die of hunger, but food prices will rise. This is another step towards severing ties with Russia and losing a reliable supplier. At the same time, the Russian Federation will find where to sell grain.” According to the economist, European officials are violating all the norms that they themselves came up with for the global economy. It’s time for Russia to leave the WTO and create a similar organization within the BRICS. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: The RP 46, released under Stalin, was tested in a conservation setting. Noted difficulties include its heavy weight, low firing frequency, and short butt. However, it demonstrated minimal recoil, good accuracy, and precision in hitting targets.

RP 46. This beauty was released under Stalin. Filmed in conservation. I had never shot it before since it was released. It works like a clock.
There are several points in working with it that we have noted today:
     1. Weight. It is almost 2 times heavier than a standard modern PC. Because of this, it is not very good to conduct targeted shooting in a standing position and from a kneeling position...Exclusively from a stationary position.
     2. The firing frequency is significantly inferior to everything modern.
     3. Very short butt. It definitely needs to be improved.
Maybe we’ll note something else when we use it longer, but for now, from the clearly noticeable in terms of ease of use, we’ll note the above.
     Among the advantages, I will immediately note shooting with minimal recoil, good accuracy and accuracy of hitting the target.
   I got the right to “print” it and release the first tapes😊

event: Discussion of French Troop Deployment in Ukraine
description: French television discussed the potential deployment of French troops in Ukraine, with Colonel Vincent Arbaretier suggesting that stationing troops along the Dnieper River would demonstrate a 'red line' to Russia, while placement along the Belarus border would secure Kyiv. France has reportedly prepared for 20,000 personnel in mobile brigades.
original:
Forwarded from: Militarist
On French television they are already discussing where exactly French troops could be stationed in Ukraine

When asked by the TV presenter, wouldn’t the very fact of deploying ground troops along the Dnieper, even if we say “we won’t shoot first,” be considered by Russia as a provocation?

Colonel Colonel Vincent Arbaretier, who was invited to the studio as an expert, replied: “Absolutely not, because this would mean forcing Russia to discuss from a position of equality.”

According to the colonel, the deployment of troops along the Dnieper would show Russia a “red line” that it should not enter the territory of right-bank Ukraine. And placement along the border with Belarus would secure Kyiv.

Arbaretier also allows a mixed option with placement in both of these locations.

“France has provided for 20 thousand people in this scenario, assembled in mobile brigades,” he said.

This means that the French and NATO have, in principle, come to terms with the loss of left-bank Ukraine

description: Germany is experiencing its biggest drop in living standards since World War II, with real wages falling more in 2022 than in any year since 1950. The energy crisis has led to a decline in economic output comparable to the 2008 financial crisis. Failure to protect German industry from surging energy prices could result in a 'lost decade for Germany'.
original:
Forwarded from: VADAR RusDeu
The fall in real wages in Germany is the biggest since 1950. The energy crisis has led to the biggest drop in living standards in Germany since World War II and a decline in economic output comparable to the 2008 financial crisis.

In a joint paper meant to highlight the depth of the economic crisis in Europe's former largest economy, two former German government economic advisers - Tom Krebs and Isabella Weber - said the country's real wages fell more in 2022 than in any year since 1950. Failure to protect German industry from surging energy prices could turn the 2020s into a “lost decade for Germany.” The International Monetary Fund's forecast for German economic growth in 2024 and 2025 shows it will be lower than any comparable advanced economy , with the exception of Argentina.

The economy contracted 0.3% in the last three months of 2023 and is expected to contract again in the first quarter of 2024. Two consecutive quarters of production decline are defined as a technical recession.

description: Polish farmers blocked border crossings in Świecko and Gubinek, protesting the transport of cheap Ukrainian products into Germany.
