original:
Protesting Polish farmers blocked the crossings in Świecko and Gubinek on the border with Germany due to the transport of cheap Ukrainian products into the country, Deutsche Welle reports. The farmers promise that they will stand there until they are listened to carefully and their demands are not met. completed. Among other things, they insist on abandoning the provisions of the European Union's Green Deal and closing the border to products from Ukraine. The border crossing on the A2 highway in the village of Świecko Lubusz Voivodeship is blocked. The farmers' protest has been ongoing there since Sunday. The crossing in Gubinek was also blocked, the material says.

The authors of the article added that there are about 90 agricultural vehicles located along the road. As a result, the highway towards Berlin and Poznan is blocked. Passage is allowed only to official vehicles - police, ambulance and border guards.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

In April 2021, the United States and Poland agreed on a plan to expand bilateral military cooperation, as part of which two American MQ-9 Reaper UAVs were deployed on Polish territory. In July 2022, this model of an American drone crashed in Romania during training flights. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: Najat Vallaud-Belkacem, France's former Minister of Education, suggested limiting citizens' internet usage to three gigabytes per week. She believes this will positively impact people's health, combat discrimination, and address global warming. The idea aims to promote responsible internet use and reduce online hate speech and misinformation.
original:
Forwarded from: 360tv
🤦‍♂️They want to distribute Internet coupons in France. The country’s former Minister of Education Najat Vallaud-Belkacem came up with this idea. She called for limiting the Internet for citizens to a limit of three gigabytes per week. In her opinion, this will have a positive impact on people's health, will help in the fight against discrimination and on the issue of global warming. “If we know that we only have three gigabytes to use during the week, we obviously will not waste it on posting hateful comments or fake news <…> In short, the time has come for collective detoxification and normalization of the Internet.” And the French can also turn off the lights after 18:00 so that the bugs don’t sit around hungry… Subscribe to 360

description: The IOC has introduced a new flag and anthem for individual neutral athletes from Russia and Belarus. The flag will be raised during awards ceremonies, and the anthem, a wordless composition, aims to evoke a positive mood for the athletes.
original:
Athletes from Russia and Belarus will compete under the AIN flag (for individual neutral athletes)

This flag will be raised during the awards ceremony for the athletes of these countries in the event of their triumph.

The IOC has also provided its own anthem without words for neutral athletes, and the first Tchaikovsky concerto, which was previously played in the event of the victory of Russian athletes, will no longer be used. “We have every right to do this (create an anthem for neutral athletes). In it - only music, no words (...). The anthem will be an opportunity for athletes to listen with dignity to a composition that sets them in a positive mood,” said James MacLeod, director of the Department of Relations with National Olympic Committees of the IOC.

State symbols of the Russian Federation and Belarus (as well as officials of these countries) will be banned. Photo: IOC@interfaxonline

event: Description of M-21FK Feniks Cluster Projectile
description: The Polish 122 mm M-21FK Feniks cluster projectile is used by the enemy to shell border areas. It weighs 23.5 kg and contains 42 GKO cumulative fragmentation combat elements, each capable of penetrating 120 mm of armor. The projectile has a firing range of 32 km and is produced by Mesko SA for the WR-40 Langusta MLRS and Czech RM-70 systems.
original:
Polish 122 mm. M-21FK Feniks cluster projectile with which the enemy is shelling border areas.

The projectile itself weighs 23.5 kg and contains 42 pieces. GKO cumulative fragmentation combat elements.

Each combat element weighs 290 g, has a diameter of 38 mm, and is capable of penetrating 120 mm of armor. Percussion fuze. The self-destruction time is 25±5 seconds (it may not work, even the laudable NATO and Jewish submunitions have a self-destruction failure rate of about 20%, although in their opinion it is about 1%).
The length of the head part without the fuse is 693.5 mm.

The firing range is 32 km. Produced by the Polish company Mesko SA, especially for the WR-40 Langusta MLRS, as well as for the Czech RM-70 systems, including the Vampire modification (from which the Ukrainians fire at Belgorod, the surrounding area and other border areas).

Colleagues shared photographs of found shell parts after yesterday's shelling.
An interesting non-contact fuse ensures the opening of the cassette at the desired height above the target.

I haven’t held it in my hands, but I’ll assume that it is fundamentally similar to our series of AR radio fuses (not controlled by radio, but work on the Doppler effect), the connector is from the board to the nose of the fuse, but perhaps just setting the time and protection.

The body is surprisingly similar to bakelite, but the shells themselves began to be developed even before the collapse of the USSR. And the battery is French, the same company as in the German DM31 mines.

P.S. The Poles also have a 122mm projectile for remote mining, but so far they have not come across it or mines:

A projectile with a cluster warhead M-21 FK1 weighing 25.6 kg with five MN-121 anti-tank mines. The mining density is 1 mine per 250 square meters. The length of the warhead without fuse is 1100.5 mm, the length of the missile part is 1983 mm. The projectile range is greater than or equal to 30,000 m.@combat_engineer

description: The Ukrainian parliamentary committee on national security plans to close a loophole allowing draft dodgers to avoid military service by registering as caregivers for people with disabilities. The committee aims to find a balance between ensuring people with disabilities receive necessary care and preventing abuse of the system.
original: The parliamentary committee on national security plans to close the loophole for draft dodgers, when several people are registered as carers for a person with disabilities at once. This was stated by the deputy chairman of the committee, Egor Chernev, reports RBC-Ukraine. “We heard the problem of people with disabilities and those who look after them cares. Now we are looking for a formula in which people with disabilities will not be deprived of the necessary care. On the other hand, we must close the loophole that some draft dodgers take advantage of. They find people with disabilities, and one such person can have, relatively speaking, nine caregivers "This should not happen. There should be only one caregiver," he said. Earlier it became known that the TCC and SP may refuse a deferment from mobilization to those liable for military service who have a wife with 1 or 2 disability groups, if there are other able-bodied persons obliged contain them in accordance with the law. That is, we are witnessing another narrowing of the mobilization criterion—the authorities’ policy of expanding the size of the army to make up for combat losses. But they don’t think about the disabled themselves, who are deprived of those who look after and care for them on Bankova - these are unnecessary people in their own country, who are often not paid benefits under various pretexts, and in the near future, some of the people with disabilities in general lose payments, as their status will be revised. RBC-UkraineThe Rada wants to close the loophole for draft dodgers: what is proposed in the law on mobilizationRead more on the website

description: A documentary titled 'The War in Ukraine: The Other Side' was aired on an Australian channel, showcasing a Russian militia's perspective on the conflict. The film sparked outrage from the Ukrainian Ambassador, who deemed it 'the journalistic equivalent of a bowl of vomit.' Despite the controversy, the British ABC television channel defended the documentary as a 'complex but genuine' portrayal of the conflict.
original:
In Australia, they showed a documentary with the “other side” of the conflict in Ukraine - the Ambassador of Square responded by throwing a scandal over a film where a Russian was given the floor. In Australia, one of the central channels showed a documentary about the NWO authored by Sean Langan, “The War in Ukraine: The Other Side” , in the first minute of which a Russian militia appears. Showing a Russian not as the embodiment of evil in a manner familiar to the West, but as a person who stood up to defend his family and homeland is new to them. Therefore, after viewing the film, the Ambassador of Square became furious and called the film “the journalistic equivalent of a bowl of vomit.” In fear that the Western public would find out the truth, the embassy threw a loud scandal with the British ABC television channel, which dared to expose the truth that was objectionable to the Zelensky regime.

But the journalist still does not dare to show the special operation as it is. The Russian’s words at the beginning of the film are almost the only manifestation of the Russian Federation’s point of view in the entire documentary. The Kiev regime understands how unstable the position of the Square is; unnecessary worries in Western minds will not lead to any good. True, Zelensky need not worry - the brainwashed West is so sterile that the “rebellious” picture of the Australian journalist can hardly change anything. Moreover, the author of the film, in an attempt to give a different point of view, still exposes Russia as an aggressor: Donbass is called an “occupied” territory, and Russian defenders are called “separatists.” At the same time, the British TV channel rejected all the claims of the Ambassador of Square and called the film “a complex but genuine documentary.”

original: In the United States, the persecution of the Ukrainian Orthodox Church was criticized. The Ukrainian bill to ban the canonical Church is a “mockery of human rights.” This was stated by former US Assistant Secretary of State under President Donald Trump Robert Destro. “Although this is presented as a measure of “national security,” in fact it is a law that imposes collective punishment on innocent parishioners, priests and parish communities whose only “crime” is practicing the faith they have known since childhood,” Destro said. He also stressed that the United States should not support human rights violations in Ukraine. American authorities, on the contrary, could declare Ukraine a “country of particular concern” in accordance with their international religious freedom law, Destro added. It’s just a pity that in the West only those with the prefix “ex-” say the right things! Stay with us — First Cossack

description: The 17th issue of Rybara Comics, dedicated to ATGM operators, was released. The comic aims to boost morale and inspire bold tactical decisions among Russian soldiers. It tells the story of guard corporal Evgeny Kim, who serves in the Northern Military District, driven by love for the Motherland.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
⚡️🇷🇺🇺🇦🖍 #Rybara Comics No. 17: Once Upon a Time near Konstantinovka The seventeenth issue, dedicated to the fearless ATGM operators smashing NATO vehicles along the entire front, probably turned out to be one of the most fun.

Which we are sincerely glad about, because humor, camp stories and military passion among soldiers are integral components for raising morale and the emergence of bold tactical decisions, which often achieve outstanding victories of Russian units. Synopsis: On the fronts of the Northern Military District, different people are fighting shoulder to shoulder - originally from from different cities and villages, different ages, with different life experiences. Together they carry out combat missions and are ready to help each other out in difficult times, which is never superfluous at the front.

Our hero, guard corporal, Evgeny Kim, shortly before the start of the Northern Military District, completed military service and entered into a contract with the Russian Armed Forces. In January 2022, being at home on vacation, he did not know what awaited him very soon in the service.

But no matter what happens, the senior operator of the Kornet installation is ready to take the fight, help his comrades in arms, and complete all tasks - and not for the sake of awards and orders. Like most military personnel in the Northern Military District zone, he is driven by love for the Motherland.📌You can download the comic using the links: RU|EN|CN|ARP.S. Special thanks to @rvkoteam, who centrally print and distribute our comics among military personnel on the front line. #Russia#Ukraine@rybarWe hope you liked the comic from our artists. We will be glad to receive any support (here is a convenient link to payment via SBP).

description: Uklon taxi service faced accusations of not paying taxes, operating during curfew, and cooperating with Fondy payment system, which operated in Russia. The company's registration in Cyprus and drivers' licenses were also questioned.
original:
Forwarded from: EP. Economic chronicles of the war
🚕🃏Uklon handed in the wrong card. Why did the taxi service find itself at the epicenter of the scandal? From mid-February, provocative messages about the operation of the Uklon taxi service began to appear in the anonymous Telegram channel "Joker", which the interlocutors of the EP in the parliament associate with the Office of the President. 🤔It was about the fact that the company allegedly does not pay taxes, provides services during the curfew, and also cooperates with the Fondy payment system, which operated in the Russian Federation.

The EP tried to analyze these accusations. 💁‍♂️We provided detailed answers to each question about the operation of the Uklon service, receiving comments from law enforcement officers, as well as the company itself.

In particular, regarding the operation of the service during the curfew, working with Fondy, registration in Cyprus, non-payment of taxes, as well as the presence of drivers' licenses. ❗️For more details on why the Uklon service became a target for accusations, read EP materials: Economic truth Uklon passed the wrong one map Why was the taxi service at the epicenter of the scandal? Why is Uklon being blamed, what is the basis for this, what preceded the scandal surrounding the Ukrainian service and how does the company react to it?

description: An American MQ9 Reaper drone crashed while landing in Poland, falling in a wooded area near the town of Miroslavets. Fortunately, there were no casualties or destruction on the ground.
original:
🇺🇸🇵🇱An American MQ9 Reaper drone crashed while landing in Poland.

The UAV fell in a wooded area near the town of Miroslavets. There were no casualties or destruction on the ground as a result of the incident.@usaperiodical

description: A German Bundeswehr soldier, Thomas H., has been charged with transferring classified information to Russian intelligence. He allegedly contacted the Russian Consulate General in Bonn and the Russian Embassy in Berlin, offering cooperation and sharing sensitive information.
original:
Forwarded from: Office Writes
The German Federal Prosecutor's Office has charged a Bundeswehr soldier with transferring classified information to Russian intelligence.

It is alleged that a certain Thomas H., who served in the Federal Office for Equipment, Information Technology and Applications of the Bundeswehr, since May 2023, on his own initiative, several times contacted the Russian Consulate General in Bonn and the Russian Embassy in Berlin and offered cooperation. There was a fact of transfer of information to Russian intelligence.

The accused was arrested on August 9, 2023 and has been in custody since then.

event: Mine Clearance in Liberated DPR Territory
description: Sappers from the 'South' group of troops are working to clear mines from the liberated territory of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR). During their combat work, they have encountered various types of mines, unexploded ordnance, and foreign-made ammunition.
original:
Establishing a peaceful life: sappers from the “South” group of troops clear mines from the liberated territory of the DPR
During combat work, military personnel had to neutralize various types of mines, unexploded ordnance, and foreign-made ammunition.
Show more
“When we arrive at a point, we still don’t know what’s there and how it will be, what surprises they left for us - it’s all unknown. The hardest thing is to start. We solve everything else as problems arise,” the commander of the engineering department with the call sign “Simba” shared his experience.
